Authors:
Gill Challen, Maria Sergeevna Vorontsova, Harald Schneider,
Martin Cheek
Title:
Phylogenetically distinct and critically endangered new tree
species of Phyllanthus from Cameroon (Phyllanthaceae, Euphorbiaceae
s.l.)
Keywords:
Cameroon, conservation, Critically Endangered,
Phyllanthus, Phyllanthaceae, tree
Abstract:
Phyllanthus kidna, the only tree species of Phyllanthus
from Cameroon, is described and analysed. Its bilocular berries and two
connate stamens indicate no affiliation with any known species or
infrageneric group within Phyllanthus. Phylogenetic analyses place it as
sister to the Indian and East African species Phyllanthus pinnatus and
is also related to the New World species of Phyllanthus acidus and
Phyllanthus chacoensis. Only five individuals are currently known and
the species is assessed as Critically Endangered. The Proposed Mefou
National Park near Yaound√© could save this species from extinction.
